questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.description: Choose the correct expansion for the acronym HTML.
questions.hint: Think about the basic structure of web pages.

options.label: A
options.description: Hypertext Markup Language
options.explanation: Correct! HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language.

options.label: B
options.description: Hyper Transfer Markup Language
options.explanation: Incorrect. The correct expansion is 'Hypertext Markup Language.'

options.label: C
options.description: High-Level Text Management Language
options.explanation: Incorrect. The correct expansion is 'Hypertext Markup Language.'

questions.question: What is the main purpose of HTML?
questions.description: Select the option that best describes the primary function of HTML.
questions.hint: Consider the role of HTML in creating web pages.

options.label: A
options.description: Styling web pages
options.explanation: Incorrect. HTML is primarily used for structuring content, not styling.

options.label: B
options.description: Creating dynamic content
options.explanation: Incorrect. HTML provides structure; dynamic content is often handled by JavaScript.

options.label: C
options.description: Structuring content on web pages
options.explanation: Correct! HTML is used to structure content on web pages.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating a hyperlink?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag that is commonly used to create links.
questions.hint: Think about how you navigate from one web page to another.

options.label: A
options.description: <link>
options.explanation: Incorrect. The <link> tag is used for including external resources like stylesheets.

options.label: B
options.explanation: Correct! The <a> tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

options.label: C
options.description: <url>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no <url> tag in HTML; use <a> for hyperlinks.

questions.question: What does the 'HTML' element define in a web page?
questions.description: Choose the correct interpretation of the 'HTML' element's role.
questions.hint: Consider the overall structure of an HTML document.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines the content of the web page
options.explanation: Correct! The <html> element contains the entire content of the web page.

options.label: B
options.description: Styles the web page
options.explanation: Incorrect. Styling is usually done with CSS, not the <html> element.

options.label: C
options.description: Executes JavaScript code
options.explanation: Incorrect. JavaScript execution is handled by the <script> tag, not <html>.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating a line break?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag commonly used to insert a line break.
questions.hint: Think about how to separate content on different lines.

options.label: A
options.explanation:
Correct! The
tag is used to create a line break in HTML.

options.label: B
options.description: <lb>
options.explanation:
Incorrect. There is no tag for line breaks; use
.

options.label: C
options.description: <newline>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no <newline> tag for line breaks in HTML.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid HTML tag?
questions.description: Identify the tag that is not a part of the HTML specification.
questions.hint: Consider the common HTML tags used for structuring content.

options.label: A
options.explanation:
Incorrect.

is a valid HTML tag for paragraphs.

options.label: B
options.description: <div>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <div> is a valid HTML tag for dividing content into sections.

options.label: C
options.description: <circle>
options.explanation: Correct! <circle> is not a valid HTML tag; use <div> for structuring content.

questions.question: What does the 'alt' attribute in an 'img' tag stand for?
questions.description: Select the correct interpretation of the 'alt' attribute in an 'img' tag.
questions.hint: Consider the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in images.

options.label: A
options.description: Alternative text
options.explanation: Correct! The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for an image.

options.label: B
options.description: Image link
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'alt' is not for creating links; it's for alternative text.

options.label: C
options.description: Alignment
options.explanation: Incorrect. Alignment is usually controlled by CSS, not the 'alt' attribute.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating an unordered list?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag commonly used for creating a bulleted list.
questions.hint: Think about how items are typically organized in an unordered list.

options.label: A
options.description: <ol>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <ol> is used for ordered lists, not unordered lists.

options.label: B
options.description: <li>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <li> is used for list items but not for the entire list.

options.label: C
options.description: <ul>
options.explanation: Correct! The <ul> tag is used for creating an unordered list.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for defining a table?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag commonly used for creating tables.
questions.hint: Think about how tabular data is structured in HTML.

options.label: A
options.description: <table>
options.explanation: Correct! The <table> tag is used for defining tables in HTML.

options.label: B
options.description: <tr>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <tr> is used for defining table rows, not the entire table.

options.label: C
options.description: <td>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <td> is used for defining table cells, not the entire table.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for adding a hyperlink to an email address?
questions.description: Identify the tag used to create a hyperlink for an email address.
questions.hint: Consider how email addresses are linked in HTML.

options.label: A
options.description: <mail>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no <mail> tag for email hyperlinks; use <a>.

options.label: B
options.description: <email>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no <email> tag for email hyperlinks; use <a>.

options.label: C
options.description: <a href='mailto:'>
options.explanation: Correct! Use <a href='mailto:'> to create a hyperlink for an email address.

questions.question: What does the 'DOCTYPE' declaration in HTML do?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'DOCTYPE' declaration.
questions.hint: Consider the role of 'DOCTYPE' in defining the document type.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines the content of the web page
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'DOCTYPE' is not for defining content; it specifies the document type.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the character set
options.explanation: Incorrect. Character set is usually specified with the 'meta' tag, not 'DOCTYPE.'

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the document type and version of HTML
options.explanation: Correct! 'DOCTYPE' defines the document type and version of HTML being used.

questions.question: What does the 'head' element in HTML contain?
questions.description: Choose the correct content typically found within the 'head' element.
questions.hint: Consider elements that provide meta-information and links to external resources.

options.label: A
options.description: Main content of the web page
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'head' element usually contains meta-information, not main content.

options.label: B
options.description: Body of the web page
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'body' element contains the main content of the web page.

options.label: C
options.description: Metadata and links to external resources
options.explanation: Correct! The 'head' element contains metadata and links to external resources.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating a numbered list?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag commonly used for creating an ordered list.
questions.hint: Think about how items are typically organized in an ordered list.

options.label: A
options.description: <ol>
options.explanation: Correct! The <ol> tag is used for creating an ordered (numbered) list.

options.label: B
options.description: <ul>
options.explanation: Incorrect. The <ul> tag is used for creating an unordered (bulleted) list.

options.label: C
options.description: <li>
options.explanation: Incorrect. The <li> tag is used for list items, not the entire ordered list.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to define the alternative text for an image?
questions.description: Choose the attribute used to provide alternative text for accessibility.
questions.hint: Consider how to describe images for users who cannot see them.

options.label: A
options.description: src
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'src' is used to specify the source file for an image, not alternative text.

options.label: B
options.description: alt
options.explanation: Correct! The 'alt' attribute is used to provide alternative text for an image.

options.label: C
options.description: title
options.explanation: Incorrect. 'title' is used for additional information about an element, not image alternative text.

questions.question: In HTML, which element is used for creating a hyperlink?
questions.description: Identify the HTML element commonly used for creating hyperlinks.
questions.hint: Think about how you create links to other pages or resources.

options.label: A
options.description: <link>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <link> is used for including external resources like stylesheets, not for creating hyperlinks.

options.label: B
options.explanation: Correct! The <a> (anchor) tag is used for creating hyperlinks in HTML.

options.label: C
options.description: <nav>
options.explanation: Incorrect. <nav> is used for defining navigation links, not for creating hyperlinks.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'title' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'title' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'title' element is typically used.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines the main heading of the web page
options.explanation: Incorrect. The main heading is usually defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags, not 'title.'

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the title of the web page (shown in the browser tab)
options.explanation: Correct! The 'title' element defines the title of the web page, displayed in the browser tab.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the content of a paragraph
options.explanation:
Incorrect. Paragraph content is defined with the

tag, not 'title.'

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'meta' tag in the 'head' element?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'meta' tag in the 'head' element.
questions.hint: Consider the role of 'meta' in providing additional information about the document.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines the main content of the web page
options.explanation: Incorrect. The main content is typically defined within the 'body' element, not 'meta' in the 'head'.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies metadata about the document (e.g., character set, description)
options.explanation: Correct! The 'meta' tag is used to specify metadata, such as the character set and document description.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines a link to an external stylesheet
options.explanation: Incorrect. Linking to an external stylesheet is typically done with the '<link>' tag, not 'meta'.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating a horizontal line?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag commonly used for inserting a horizontal line.
questions.hint: Consider how to visually separate content with a horizontal line.

options.label: A
options.description: <line>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no '<line>' tag for horizontal lines; use '<hr>'.

options.label: B
options.explanation:
Incorrect. The '
' tag is used for line breaks, not horizontal lines.

options.label: C
options.description: <hr>
options.explanation: Correct! The '<hr>' tag is used for creating a horizontal line in HTML.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an 'img' tag?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an 'img' tag.
questions.hint: Consider the role of 'alt' in providing alternative text for images.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the image source file
options.explanation: Incorrect. The image source file is specified with the 'src' attribute, not 'alt'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the alignment of the image
options.explanation: Incorrect. Alignment is typically controlled by CSS, not the 'alt' attribute.

options.label: C
options.description: Provides alternative text for the image
options.explanation: Correct! The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for accessibility and if the image cannot be displayed.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating an input field for text?
questions.description: Identify the HTML tag commonly used for accepting text input.
questions.hint: Think about how users can enter text on a web page.

options.label: A
options.description: <input type='text'>
options.explanation: Correct! The '<input type='text'>' tag is used for creating a text input field in HTML.

options.label: B
options.description: <text>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no '<text>' tag specifically for text input fields; use '<input type='text'>' instead.

options.label: C
options.description: <textbox>
options.explanation: Incorrect. There is no '<textbox>' tag specifically for text input fields; use '<input type='text'>' instead.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'span' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'span' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'span' element is typically used and its impact on content.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a block-level section of content
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'span' element is an inline element, not block-level.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Correct! The 'span' element is often used as a container for styling purposes or applying inline styles.

options.label: C
options.description: Specifies a hyperlink
options.explanation: Incorrect. Hyperlinks are typically defined using the '<a>' (anchor) tag, not 'span'.

questions.question: What does the 'async' attribute do in the '<script>' tag?
questions.description: Choose the correct purpose of the 'async' attribute in the '<script>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'async' attribute affects the loading and execution of scripts.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for the script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'async'.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies the character set for the script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The character set is specified using the 'charset' attribute, not 'async'.

options.label: C
options.description: Indicates that the script should be executed asynchronously
options.explanation: Correct! The 'async' attribute allows the script to be executed asynchronously, without blocking the rendering of the page.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'figcaption' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'figcaption' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'figcaption' element is commonly used and its relation to content.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a caption for an image
options.explanation: Correct! The 'figcaption' element is used to define a caption or legend for an 'figure' element, often used with images.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies the source file for an image
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file for an image is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'figcaption'.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines a link to an external resource
options.explanation: Incorrect. Linking to external resources is typically done with the '<a>' (anchor) tag, not 'figcaption'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'form' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'form' element.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'form' element is used to structure and handle user input.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'form' element is primarily used for handling user input, not for styling purposes.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies metadata about the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. Metadata is typically specified in the 'head' element using 'meta', not 'form'.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines a section for user input and form controls
options.explanation: Correct! The 'form' element is used to create a section for user input and form controls in HTML.

questions.question: What does the 'target' attribute in the '<a>' tag specify?
questions.description: Choose the correct purpose of the 'target' attribute in the '<a>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'target' attribute affects where a linked resource is displayed.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the link's URL
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'href' attribute is used to specify the link's URL, not 'target'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the link's text
options.explanation: Incorrect. The link's text is defined between the opening and closing '<a>' tags, not with 'target'.

options.label: C
options.description: Specifies where to open the linked resource (e.g., in a new window)
options.explanation: Correct! The 'target' attribute determines where the linked resource is displayed, such as in a new window or tab.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'article' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'article' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'article' element is typically used and its relation to content.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a heading for a section of content
options.explanation: Incorrect. Headings are typically defined with the '<h1>' to '<h6>' tags, not 'article'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'article' element is not primarily used for styling purposes; it's for structuring content.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines an independent, self-contained piece of content
options.explanation: Correct! The 'article' element is used to define an independent, self-contained piece of content that could be distributed and reused independently.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'cite' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'cite' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'cite' element is typically used and its relation to content.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for an external script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file for an external script is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'cite'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'cite' element is not primarily used for styling purposes; it's for indicating the title of a creative work.

options.label: C
options.description: Indicates the title of a creative work (e.g., book, movie)
options.explanation: Correct! The 'cite' element is used to indicate the title of a creative work referenced in the content.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'details' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'details' element.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'details' element is used to provide additional information.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a section for user input and form controls
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'details' element is not primarily used for user input and form controls; it's for creating a disclosure widget.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies metadata about the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. Metadata is typically specified in the 'head' element using 'meta', not 'details'.

options.label: C
options.description: Creates a disclosure widget to show or hide additional information
options.explanation: Correct! The 'details' element is used to create a disclosure widget that allows users to show or hide additional information.

questions.question: What does the 'placeholder' attribute do in an '<input>' tag?
questions.description: Choose the correct purpose of the 'placeholder' attribute in an '<input>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'placeholder' attribute provides a hint or example for user input.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the initial value for the input
options.explanation: Incorrect. The initial value is typically specified using the 'value' attribute, not 'placeholder'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the label for the input field
options.explanation: Incorrect. The label is usually provided as text or with the 'label' element, not 'placeholder'.

options.label: C
options.description: Provides a hint or example for the expected input
options.explanation: Correct! The 'placeholder' attribute provides a hint or example for the expected input in an input field.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'summary' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'summary' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'summary' element is commonly used and its impact on content.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies metadata about the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. Metadata is typically specified in the 'head' element using 'meta', not 'summary'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a heading for a section of content
options.explanation: Incorrect. Headings are typically defined with the '<h1>' to '<h6>' tags, not 'summary'.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines a visible heading for a 'details' element
options.explanation: Correct! The 'summary' element is used to define a visible heading for a 'details' element, providing a label for the associated disclosure widget.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'role' attribute in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'role' attribute.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'role' attribute is used to define the function of an element.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for an external script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file for an external script is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'role'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'role' attribute is not primarily used for styling purposes; it's for defining the function or purpose of an element for accessibility.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the function or purpose of an element for accessibility
options.explanation: Correct! The 'role' attribute is used to define the function or purpose of an element for accessibility, especially for assistive technologies.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'aria-label' attribute in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'aria-label' attribute.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'aria-label' attribute is used to provide a label for accessibility.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for an external script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file for an external script is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'aria-label'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a label for an image
options.explanation: Incorrect. While 'alt' is used for image labels, 'aria-label' is used for providing labels to elements for accessibility.

options.label: C
options.description: Provides a label for an element for accessibility
options.explanation: Correct! The 'aria-label' attribute is used to provide a label for an element, especially when the visual label is not sufficient for accessibility.

questions.question: What does the 'defer' attribute do in the '<script>' tag?
questions.description: Choose the correct purpose of the 'defer' attribute in the '<script>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'defer' attribute affects the loading and execution of scripts.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for the script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'defer'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates that the script should be executed asynchronously
options.explanation: Incorrect. Asynchronous execution is controlled by the 'async' attribute, not 'defer'.

options.label: C
options.description: Specifies that the script should be executed after the document has been parsed
options.explanation: Correct! The 'defer' attribute indicates that the script should be executed after the document has been parsed, but before 'DOMContentLoaded'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'scoped' attribute in the '<style>' tag?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'scoped' attribute in the '<style>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'scoped' attribute affects the styling of elements.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for an external stylesheet
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file for an external stylesheet is specified using the 'link' tag, not 'scoped'.

options.label: B
options.description: Applies styles only to the parent element and its descendants
options.explanation: Correct! The 'scoped' attribute in the '<style>' tag applies styles only to the parent element and its descendants, not globally.

options.label: C
options.description: Indicates that the styles should be applied globally
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'scoped' attribute limits the styles to the parent element and its descendants, not globally.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'figure' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'figure' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'figure' element is commonly used and its relation to content.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'figure' element is not primarily used for styling purposes; it's for grouping and referencing content like images and illustrations.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies metadata about the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. Metadata is typically specified in the 'head' element using 'meta', not 'figure'.

options.label: C
options.description: Groups and references content, such as images and illustrations
options.explanation: Correct! The 'figure' element is used to group and reference content, such as images and illustrations, with an optional 'figcaption' element for a caption.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'article' element in HTML?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'article' element.
questions.hint: Consider where the 'article' element is typically used and its relation to content.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a heading for a section of content
options.explanation: Incorrect. Headings are typically defined with the '<h1>' to '<h6>' tags, not 'article'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'article' element is not primarily used for styling purposes; it's for structuring and marking up independent pieces of content.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines an independent, self-contained piece of content
options.explanation: Correct! The 'article' element is used to define an independent, self-contained piece of content that can be distributed and reused independently.

questions.question: How does the 'rel' attribute in the '<a>' tag contribute to link behavior?
questions.description: Choose the correct contribution of the 'rel' attribute in the '<a>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'rel' attribute specifies the relationship between the linked resource and the current document.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the link's text
options.explanation: Incorrect. The link's text is defined between the opening and closing '<a>' tags, not with 'rel'.

options.label: B
options.description: Specifies the link's URL
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'href' attribute is used to specify the link's URL, not 'rel'.

options.label: C
options.description: Specifies the relationship between the linked resource and the current document
options.explanation: Correct! The 'rel' attribute in the '<a>' tag specifies the relationship between the linked resource and the current document, influencing link behavior.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an 'area' tag?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an 'area' tag.
questions.hint: Consider the role of 'alt' in providing alternative text for areas defined in an image map.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the image source file
options.explanation: Incorrect. The image source file is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'alt'.

options.label: B
options.description: Provides alternative text for the area defined in an image map
options.explanation: Correct! The 'alt' attribute in an 'area' tag provides alternative text for the area defined in an image map, enhancing accessibility.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the shape of the area in an image map
options.explanation: Incorrect. The shape of the area in an image map is typically defined using the 'shape' attribute, not 'alt'.

questions.question: How does the 'colspan' attribute in the '<td>' tag affect table cells?
questions.description: Choose the correct effect of the 'colspan' attribute in the '<td>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'colspan' influences the horizontal span of table cells.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the background color of the table cell
options.explanation: Incorrect. The background color is typically controlled by CSS or the 'bgcolor' attribute, not 'colspan'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the vertical span of the table cell
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'rowspan' attribute is used to define the vertical span of a table cell, not 'colspan'.

options.label: C
options.description: Specifies the number of columns the cell should span
options.explanation: Correct! The 'colspan' attribute in the '<td>' tag specifies the number of columns the cell should span horizontally in a table.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'role' attribute in the '<nav>' tag?
questions.description: Select the correct purpose of the 'role' attribute in the '<nav>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how the 'role' attribute is used to define the function of an element, especially for accessibility.

options.label: A
options.description: Defines a container for styling purposes
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'role' attribute is not primarily used for styling purposes; it's for defining the function or purpose of an element.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates that the element represents navigation links
options.explanation: Correct! The 'role' attribute in the '<nav>' tag indicates that the element represents navigation links, providing semantic information for accessibility.

options.label: C
options.description: Specifies the source file for an external script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file for an external script is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'role'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'contenteditable' attribute in HTML.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'contenteditable' attribute.
questions.hint: Consider how 'contenteditable' affects the editability of an element's content.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the character encoding for the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. The character encoding is typically specified using the 'charset' attribute or through the document's meta tags, not 'contenteditable'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates whether the content of an element is editable
options.explanation: Correct! The 'contenteditable' attribute is used to make the content of an element editable by the user.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the language of the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. The language of the document is typically specified using the 'lang' attribute or through the document's meta tags, not 'contenteditable'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'hidden' attribute in HTML.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'hidden' attribute.
questions.hint: Consider how 'hidden' affects the visibility of an element.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the document's base URL
options.explanation: Incorrect. The base URL is typically specified using the 'base' tag or through the document's meta tags, not 'hidden'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates whether the element's content should be displayed
options.explanation: Correct! The 'hidden' attribute is used to indicate whether the element's content should be displayed or not.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the alignment of the element
options.explanation: Incorrect. The alignment of the element is typically controlled through CSS properties, not 'hidden'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'sandbox' attribute in the '<iframe>' tag.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'sandbox' attribute in the '<iframe>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'sandbox' enhances security when embedding content.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the source file for the content to be embedded
options.explanation: Incorrect. The source file is typically specified using the 'src' attribute, not 'sandbox'.

options.label: B
options.description: Enables an extra layer of security when embedding content
options.explanation: Correct! The 'sandbox' attribute in the '<iframe>' tag enables an extra layer of security by restricting what the embedded content can do.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the dimensions of the iframe
options.explanation: Incorrect. The dimensions of the iframe are typically specified using the 'width' and 'height' attributes, not 'sandbox'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'defer' attribute in the '<link>' tag.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'defer' attribute in the '<link>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'defer' affects the loading of external stylesheets.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the media type for the stylesheet
options.explanation: Incorrect. The media type is typically specified using the 'media' attribute, not 'defer'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates that the stylesheet should be deferred for asynchronous loading
options.explanation: Correct! The 'defer' attribute in the '<link>' tag indicates that the stylesheet should be deferred for asynchronous loading.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the relationship between the document and the stylesheet
options.explanation: Incorrect. The relationship is typically specified using the 'rel' attribute, not 'defer'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'draggable' attribute in HTML.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'draggable' attribute.
questions.hint: Consider how 'draggable' affects the drag-and-drop behavior of an element.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the MIME type of the dragged data
options.explanation: Incorrect. The MIME type is typically specified using the 'type' attribute, not 'draggable'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates whether the element's content can be dragged
options.explanation: Correct! The 'draggable' attribute is used to indicate whether the element's content can be dragged by the user.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the drop effect for the dragged data
options.explanation: Incorrect. The drop effect is typically controlled through JavaScript when handling drag-and-drop events, not 'draggable'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'crossorigin' attribute in the '<script>' tag.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'crossorigin' attribute in the '<script>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'crossorigin' addresses security concerns when loading scripts from external sources.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the character encoding for the script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The character encoding is typically specified using the 'charset' attribute, not 'crossorigin'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the relationship between the document and the script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The relationship is typically specified using the 'rel' attribute, not 'crossorigin'.

options.label: C
options.description: Addresses security concerns when loading scripts from external sources
options.explanation: Correct! The 'crossorigin' attribute in the '<script>' tag addresses security concerns when loading scripts from external sources, especially for cross-origin requests.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'translate' attribute in HTML.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'translate' attribute.
questions.hint: Consider how 'translate' affects the translation behavior of an element's content.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the language of the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. The language is typically specified using the 'lang' attribute, not 'translate'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates whether the element's content should be translated
options.explanation: Correct! The 'translate' attribute is used to indicate whether the element's content should be translated when the page is localized.

options.label: C
options.description: Defines the text direction of the element
options.explanation: Incorrect. The text direction is typically specified using the 'dir' attribute, not 'translate'.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'nonce' attribute in the '<script>' tag.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'nonce' attribute in the '<script>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'nonce' enhances security when executing inline scripts.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the character encoding for the script
options.explanation: Incorrect. The character encoding is typically specified using the 'charset' attribute, not 'nonce'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the inline script's position in the document
options.explanation: Incorrect. The position of the inline script is determined by its placement in the HTML document, not 'nonce'.

options.label: C
options.description: Enhances security when executing inline scripts by specifying a cryptographic nonce
options.explanation: Correct! The 'nonce' attribute in the '<script>' tag enhances security by specifying a cryptographic nonce, allowing only scripts with a matching nonce to be executed.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'ping' attribute in the '<a>' tag.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'ping' attribute in the '<a>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'ping' contributes to tracking navigation requests.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the link's text
options.explanation: Incorrect. The link's text is defined between the opening and closing '<a>' tags, not with 'ping'.

options.label: B
options.description: Defines the link's URL
options.explanation: Incorrect. The 'href' attribute is used to specify the link's URL, not 'ping'.

options.label: C
options.description: Contributes to tracking navigation requests by specifying additional URLs
options.explanation: Correct! The 'ping' attribute in the '<a>' tag contributes to tracking navigation requests by specifying additional URLs that should be pinged (requested) when the link is clicked.

questions.question: Explain the purpose of the 'autocomplete' attribute in the '<form>' tag.
questions.description: Provide an explanation for the purpose and usage of the 'autocomplete' attribute in the '<form>' tag.
questions.hint: Consider how 'autocomplete' influences the automatic filling of form fields.

options.label: A
options.description: Specifies the form's action URL
options.explanation: Incorrect. The form's action URL is typically specified using the 'action' attribute, not 'autocomplete'.

options.label: B
options.description: Indicates whether the form should be automatically submitted
options.explanation: Incorrect. The automatic submission is typically controlled using JavaScript or the 'submit' button, not 'autocomplete'.

options.label: C
options.description: Influences the automatic filling of form fields by the browser
options.explanation: Correct! The 'autocomplete' attribute in the '<form>' tag influences the automatic filling of form fields by the browser, providing suggestions based on the user's input history.
